description.h2: The DTS of an instance must have no distinct elements having the same English standard label.
description.p: Users will most often see the English standard label of a concept, and it decreases clarity if distinct elements have the same label. Note that there is no restriction on elements having duplicated labels for other values of an xlink:role attribute.
REMARK: this restriction applies to all elements, not just those used in the instance.

variation.name: 6.10.4, Three elements with identical labels in different roles, GOOD.
variation.description: Three elements with identical labels in different roles, GOOD. This is also an illustration, with the presentation linkbase, of why it is never necessary to have elements with the same standard label.

variation.name: 6.10.4, Element (Statistics) with identical labels in en-US and fr in same roles. Also a label in a standard taxonomy linkbase (dei-lab-2009-01-31 DocumentType) that has been overriden and put on another element (DummyDocumentType), GOOD.
variation.description: Element (Statistics) with identical labels in en-US and fr in same roles, and a label in a standard taxonomy linkbase (dei-lab-2009-01-31 DocumentType) that has been overriden and put on another element (DummyDocumentType), GOOD.

variation.name: 6.10.4, two non-abstract elements with identical en-US labels in the standard role, NOGOOD.
variation.description: two non-abstract elements with identical en-US labels in the standard role, NOGOOD.

variation.name: 6.10.4, an abstract and a member element with identical en-US labels in the standard role, NOGOOD.
variation.description: an abstract and a member element with identical en-US labels in the standard role, NOGOOD.
